result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jimmie V. Vang

records.addlTxt: Motion to Release Defendant from Bond
Motion hearing on November 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Clerk: Heather.
Case Called: 10:52 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Ben Vechinski in person. Defendant appears in person with Atty Travis Slattery via Zoom. 
Date and time set for a status hearing. 
VRCW. 

Atty Slattery recites history of the case, indicates his client was found incompetent and case was suspended. 
Atty Slattery notes his client will not have a guardianship action filed by the county, and requests the case be dismissed. 
State objects to the case being dismissed.
COURT addresses parties.
COURT DENIES oral motion, but will allow written motion to be filed with case law and statutes cited for reconsideration.
Atty Slattery requests his client to be released from bond conditions.
State objects to modifying the bond.
Atty Slattery recites basis for oral motion re: bond.
COURT declines to make ruling today, requests a written motion to be filed for reconsideration.
Atty Slattery requests a motion hearing. 

DATES:
MH: 11/28/22 @ 1:30 p.m. (1/2 hr).

Adjourned: 11:04 a.m.
Status hearing on October 18, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Calendar call on September 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Letter to the Court requesting status conference

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Heather.
Case Called: 2:34 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett in person. Defendant appears in person with Atty Travis Slattery.
Date and time set for a competency hearing.
VRCW. 

Parties have received the report and there are no objections.
ADA Barnett is requesting the proceedings to be suspended at this time so Corp Counsel has time to review the matter.
COURT accepts stipulation and receives Doctor Benson's report; finds Defendant incompetent and suspends this case.
Parties to schedule status hearing in 60 days from today, with JA.
ADA Barnett to draft order.

Adjourned: 2:38. p.m.
Steven A. Benson, PhD
regarding release of videotaped statement(s)
Re: Order regarding release of videotaped statement(s)
Stipulation regarding use of videotaped statements

ADDRESS INFO for Jimmie V. Vang
Current: 601 Maple St, Wausau, WI 54401 United States  (Effective: 04-05-2022)
Prior: 715 Kickbusch Street, Wausau, WI 54403

Case called: 8:32 a.m.
Clerk: Heather.      
State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett; Defendant appears in person, pro se.
Date and time set for a Preliminary Hearing.
VRCW.

COURT notes Defendant has been to SDP and is not eligible;
COURT questions defendant re: employment/income;
Court finds defendant indigent;
COURT appoints Atty Travis Slattery @ $100/hr not to exceed $2500 w/o further order;
Wage Assignment: $50.00 per month.
Time limits previously waived.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: ADA Barnett appears; Deft does not appear; Deft qualifies for SPD; Prelim remains set; ** Deft appears in chambers LATE/ was by courtroom **

Pre-trial conference on March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No contact with victim(s): N.X., M.V., anyone under the age of 18. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.     Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (1) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
